text.p:
Edinburgh :
PRINTED BY JOHN ELDER .
[DA 2]
[Blank]
[DA 3]
This Song was made by Margaret M ‘ Gregor , to Colonel Alexander Robertson , of Strowan .

To make it known of your famous birth ,
You are the heir of this ancient state ,
And of all forefathers I have knowledge ,
That you are born of noble blood .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

How great enjoy came to this place ,
They know well over you are our chief ,
To hear the story their heart rejoicing ,
Their grief and sorrow that turn to mirth .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

Its now enjoy come to light ,
O ’ er all Scotland to sing and dance ,
There is great occasion except the saying ,
That you ’ r safely come to your right .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

Your highland glens will reform their greif
Through Rannoch braes the same rehearse ,
With great desire will make bone - fire
Our liquor dry ’ d with all your health .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

Colonel Robertson was your name ,
As abroad you have lately been ;
But now its truly your right renewed ,
The heir of Strowan and chief of kin .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

There was great loss at Culloden muire
The north of Scotland was brought to ruin ;
Our chiefs were forced to go abroad .
But now they ’ ll prosper as before .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

Can any tell me of a farther sight ,
Any man of a greater might ,
Who fight the battles with courage bold .
And makes the foes to take the flight .
Your welcome , strowan , &c .

Or beare the stroke when you are in rage .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

If its my song were tun ’ d in earth
It would not be a trial to explain ’ d right ,
If its wrong excuse your hand ,
Be not offended at all my works .
Your welcome , Strowan , &c .

Ged tha sinne an so an drast ,
Gun trioblaid gun anra ,
Gun aisidh ach samhach
Le pailteas bhi lamh ruinn ,
Do gach ni dheana sta dhuinn ,
Siad mo thruaigh na cairde ,
Tha gam buala sna blaraibh ,
Gun chaidribh gun bhaigh on na naimhde ,
Gun chaidribh , &c .

Gun duine sa n lathair ni annlac ,
Gun duine sa &c .

text.p:
A cuideachd a mo chridhe ,
Ga ba dligheach s tha lan cruadail ,
Se fath mo bhroin cha b iogantach ,
An dithisd dhol air chuain uainn ,
An tus nar dhealich iain ruim ,
Bha snith ruidh le m ghruaidhean ,
Se domhnul dh fhalbh a rithist ,
Chuir mo chridhalas gu smuairean ,
S mi bhi ro smuaintean , &c .

text.p:
S mi air sliabh clach a bhui - ain ,
S mo duil ri dhol suas ,
A Shealtain na duthach ,
Am bheil mo dhuchas gu buan ,
Far m ba lionar mo mhuinntir ,
S iad cluiteach gach uair ,
Tha iad nis air an dusga ,
Le urach a gluasd .
Thu maire ri rannach , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
Do shlis mar chanach na mar cala
Do dha ghruaidh ghlana mar ubhal garidh
Do bheul dearg tana o m beusich labhairt
Do dheud mar chanach s fiomh a ghaire air .
Air an ribhinn , &c .

Dh Fhalabh sinn comhla s thig i con - bhoi - dhomh ,
Bha mi ro dheoineach air san am ud ,
An deire sgeoil gur e leasich bron domh ,
Thu bhi sonrichte air carr ghael ,
Anribhinn , &c .

Ma theid thu an taobh - sin dh ion bhar aorra ,
A measg na daoine san d fhuair thu tarach ,
O Thus a gheamhrie on thain thu n ghlean so ,
Ba tric ga t ionndrinn aig na balaibh ,
An ribhinn , &c .

Eadar loch fine agus clahain disart
Mar sin s cill fhinn gnu ruig crich bhraid Alba
Nach iarradh ni leat s dheana pris dhiot
Sa chuma sida gun di gn lar ort .
Air an ribhinn &c .

Ma bhios iad slan ri tighinn ,
Cha bhi mo chridhe bronach ,
Na horo mo leanabh , &c .

Tha ciorstan shios aig cubar ,
S bhios i beo bithidh duile ri ,
Chur seachd pairt an dulachd ,
Gu n cuir sinn surd air oran ,
Na horo mo leanabh , &c ,

Is s mi bhi m onar sa n t shroin
S gu n domhnull aig baile ,
S gar am faod mi ad choir ,
Tha do bhron tighinn a m aire ,
Tha mi sgi &c .

On tha am brocair air bheag surd ,
Sud a chuis tha mi gearain
Cas a dhire nan stuc ,
Sa bhiodh luthar s gach bealeach ,
Tha mi sgi &c

S mi an coir beag cumhan ,
Am braigh ach an ruidhe ,
Cuid do m abhachd bhi cumha na m brathrain
cuid do m abhachd , &c .

Sa ghrian a tearn fo sge beinn arlair .
Hi iur bho no h uir eil , &c .

Luchd na n cridheachan fionnar ,
Sna h inntin neo - thairis ,
Tha an cuideachd aig baile ,
Gun dol an na h eilan ,
Cha n eisd iad ri m ealidh ,
Cha leir leo mo ghearain ,
Cha tuig iad mo smalan ,
Cha d aithnich iad fein e ,
Thug oirnan o , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
Da thaobh lach earachd m biodh n eilid ,
Cuim an ceilinn nach ell mo dheoin ann ,
Bhi air sron chluaini cha neil e suarach ,
An ruidh buai - ach tha nuas bho deo .
Hog orun o u , &c .

Bha righ seamas a h ochd ann
B aobhar fortain duibh fein e ,
Ged d chaill sibh an cuilodair
S mor an dosguinn a dheirich ,
Sioma sann tha na luidh
Tha fathast gun eirigh ,
S mor fhuair sibh dhroch iomairt
S Gun na cinnich ri cheil .
Slan iomra , &c .

Sud an seorsa b iat leam ,
Bhi pailt anns a tir ,
S liochd Ghabh chruim a Lochabar ,
Se ar bonn sloinne ceart e ,
Laoich shunndach a scuirtail
Nach biodh tais anns a stric .
Gabha mi rathad , &c .

Theid mi ann sa n am ann ,
Air iartas miss Bella ,
Cha diulte mi dhol ann ,
O na s anns le mi ,
Thu i cinnadail cairdail ,
Is iorsal baighail ,
Lan misneach is tionnsgail ,
Cha neil samhla ann di .
Gabh mi an rathad , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p: Tune . — Whistle and I ’ ll come to you my lad .

Si so bliadhna da dunach ,
Chuir gach duine gu luim ,
Lag phris air n fheudail ,
Chuir eis air an duthich ,
S ioma fear chaidh dhuneudan ,
Nach geileadh chean tuir ,
Sud am fath man leubh mi ,
Mo dheibhnn an truir .
Mo ruin na fir ghramail , &c .

S mi losga nan cnod ,
An conidh sa n cumaint ,
Ga n cumail fo d shron ,
Agus toitail na dunach dhiu ,
Gach ni eil sa n ardich ,
Ga phrathal ort thuile sin ,
Dh fheuchinn an sabhailinn ,
Mathair a chumain .
Nan cumin i beo ,
Sann leam gam ba duilich , &c .

Ach sonas na dh fhalbhas ,
Air an t sealbhean a dh fhanas ,
Mile mairsgair an earchall ,
Se mharbh a crodh cion - fhionn ,
Gle fhada air falbh
S math dh aithnainn am pannal
Tha iad nis naas ainmig ,
An ionaltar a bhail ,
Scha bhi sinni ri bron , &

Se call a chruibh laoidh ,
A ni a chlaoidh mi baileach ,
Bha mi gearain nan caorach ,
Bhi gan slaod air gach balla ,
Bhi gam faicinn nam faobh ,
Ann s gach craob man bhaile ,
S cha basadhan spiana ,
Nuair nach b fhiach iad m fionna .
Cha bhi sinn ri bron , &c .

Ba mhor trioblaid nam faidhan ,
Gach la air an talomh ,
Cha chualas riamh iads ,
Deanamh tair air n earras ,
Ged ba bhearteach righ daibhidh ,
Ba mhor amhghor s charraid ,
Ged tha sinn e , mar tha sinn ,
Gur nar dhuinn chi talach .
Cha bhi sinn ri bron , &c .

Dhomhnuill glac misneach ,
Ged tha an trioblaid so searbh - oirn ,
Se calldach a nich ,
Dh fhag chotric sinn sa n eanmheach ,
Ach thig cuibhle an fhortain ,
S theid clost air n earr - chall ,
S bhithid sinne cho soicail ,
Ri bodich tha n alba .
Cha bhi sinn ri bron , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
S mi am bothan nan seachd suidheachan ,
Sa n snith oirn a dorta ,
S gun ghrainich rn du - reoth sinn ,
Treobh feadh nan cosan ,
Fail ill ochors , &c .

Ma s ann thoirt fios na h imrich ,
Tha thu tighinn tiomchoill oirn ,
Fuirich uainn gu h ath - bhliadhna ,
Agus gheibh sin gu t orduch .
Fail ill , &c .

Tha am fraoch cho fliuach s cha seid e dhomh ,
Chuir sud gu eigin mhor mi ,
S paistan air bheag ceill agam ,
Gun annta fenm ge[ ? ] gum chomhna ,

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
An cluinn thu mis a mheigag chrian ,
Phian thu mi gun amhras ,
Ma bhios tu beo gu dusan bliadhna ,
Ni thu sniomh a s mathas duinn ,
Faill ill agus o , &c .

On thoisich mi ri ealaidh ,
Thug mi riamh a n aire ,
Nach deanain le m theanga ,
Farran chuir air cach ,
Thug mi an duchas ud a m she anair ,
On sann ruim a lean e ,
Am fad aa bhios mi mairean ,
Cha mhath [ ? ]am leag ma lan .

Gradh an gill ruadh ,
Se mo luaidh thair chach ,
Ged do dh fhag gle og leam ,
An tir an robh mi eolach ,
Cha neil aon bhonn broin orm ,
Comhnach ann sa nait ,
Ged do dh fhalbh mi phos leat ,
Dhaindheon mo luchd eolais ,
Choidh cha churam stor dhomh ,
S domhnull a bhi lathair ,
On sean gill ruadh , &c .

Nam ba balach diolain ,
Leis an deanain striochd ,
Bhithinn air mo chiosnach ,
Le diorras gun taing ,
Bhithin cho lan mia - thlachd ,
S gann s gu n leana ciall rium ,
Banns a bhi gam thiodhlaig ,
Sios an anart ban .
Achan se an gill ru[ ? ] ma thig mi fathasd uai , &c .

Dheanmid beadra ,
Sa mhadaim a s ma fheasgar ,
Man do s guir a chleasachd ,
Gan robh an leath - tronn ann ,
Ach nach eil seisain ,
Air shon re sheasannh ,
Ged fhuilig sinn beagan ,
Leasichi e an call .
On se an gill rua &c

Bai bai ba mo ghradh ,
Meigag bheagh a chinnain bhain ,
Meigag bheag a chinnain bhain ,
Gur i annsachd mamidh i
Faill il na hor u , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
An am dhuinn teanna ris a bhuain ,
Gun thaing beagan trioblaid oirn ,
Fhuair sinn tinneas agus fuachd ,
Thug a nuas ar misneach neach oirn ,
An sin thainig mis an talamh cruai dh ,
S fhuair mi ann an Grigarach ,
S ged ba duilich Alastair ruadh ,
Sinn bn luadh thigeadh e ,
O se mo ruin , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
Nuair rainaig mis ceann lach rainnach ,
Cha be fheill bha air m aire ,
Ach bhi g eistachd ris an ealaidh ,
Chuire farum fo na ceudan .
Be mo ruins bhi , &c .

Gad a bheirte buail mhait domh
A dhire suas ri cruaidh na leachdain ,
Bannsa suaicheantas chlann ailpain ,
A bhi ga fhaicinn air na feilltan ,
Be mo ruins , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr

w.pos: A V A N V A
w.lemma: buail buail buailt buailt buailt buailte
an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
Dh innsin aogas mo leannan ,
Cul dualach trom clannach ,
Bean is math ga d thig stemain ,
Ris an cana iad sineadh ,
Tha mi tram duilich , &c .

Dheana rathad churig ,
S thug am burn gach aon deo dheth ,
Chuir a clachan nan smuidan ,
Le fudar ga m blothig ,
S nach fhacas riamh gruig orr ,
Gad bhiodh stur is gaoth reot ann .
A so nam faic sibh , &c .

Rainig mi an leitar an toisach ,
S mi an duil ri cosnadh a b fhearr ,
Gun deanain airgid is or ann ,
Nuair rachin an ordugh mar b abhaist ,
Labhair na fior ghillan coir ,
Se am bron gu d thain thu cho tra ,
Cha neil aigainn grainn corc na eorn ,
Bithis abuich na leor gu di - mairt .
B fhearr nach tigin s an am , &c .

Chuire iad each agus gille ,
Ga h ealamh gam shire a bhan ,
Cha n fhaga iad mise na b fhaide ,
A frithal air obair nan gall ,
B fhear nach tigin , &c .

text.p:
Se Donnachi og Mac Grigair ,
An t oigair sciobalt suairc ,
Nuair thig e thun bhail so ,
Se thogas dhinn an smuairain ,
Sa luithad oiche fhada ,
Chum e cadal o na ghruagich ,
S chumach e gu madainn ,
Ann an luib a bhreacain uain i ,
Horo gur gur mi , &c .

Beir soiridh uam dh dhionnsidh an laoich ,
A thacair orm madoin dirdaoin ,
Gun shuidh sinn ma chrocan do n fhraoch ,
S gun d ol sinn a bhotal ar daoin ,
Hora ba toile , &c .

w.lemma: an uair ar ar n- àr
an uair ar ar n- àr

an uair ar ar n- àr

text.p:
Tares d[ ? ]amh t fhaicinn ann am ghlac ,
Eudar mo dha laimh ,
Sud n aisling uaith nach ceart mi ,
Chuir as domh gu lath bhrath ,
Tha saithde chubid gu geur guinach ,
Annams an sas .

Cha n fhaod do threabhs bhi mall ,
San call ri dheanamh suas againn ,
Gheibh sinn aigeich as a ghleann ,
Theid cuing gu teann ma n guaillan or[ ? ]
A duneudan gheibh sinn crann ,
Se am fasan gallt a s uailse , leinn ,
Coltar staillin soc a s bann ,
S gach ball bhios ann bi cruaidh orr

text.p: O tell mi how for to woo .

Nar thig Mc I[ ? ]oisich ,
Le sheoid oirn a srath eirn ,
Mar sud agus fear Chluainidh ,
Le am fir an gauillaibh cheil ,
Ma gheibh an cat na chru - ain thu ,
Le dhu - ain beaga geur ,
Gad bhi cach air bheagan diot ,
Bhiodh aig sa chuid fein diot ,
